CHAT.comment: Chi is unhappy with her gift and refuses for about 20 minutes to participate in the activities , though she had been cooperative during the child interview. Chi spends some of the 20 minutes alone in her bedroom , some with INV1 , and some with Mot and INV1. Chi displays a lot of passive/aggressive behavior , and throws a tantrum as INV1 is leaving after an unsuccessful visit. Mot says that Chi is nervous , and reacts by becoming stubborn (and manipulative). Chi doesn't want her older sister present while she reads. (See field notes for a more thorough description of Chi's behavior.) After calming down , Chi finally agrees to cooperate. Chi reads quickly and smoothly , though she may be relying somewhat on contextual clues. For example , slice of salami is read as stick , and Sunday is read as sunny. Chi mumbles a bit , perhaps because she is still weepy and tired from the previous situation. Mot remains in the background , speaking just a couple times to help Chi with problematic words

u.a: as if reading words rather than by telling a story , compared to fluent reading in first (repetitive) part of story
